channel.title: 317s with higher revision content
channel.description:
Someone tell me the point of this? Like, why? Seriously, if you are just going to want to use the higher revision content why not use a higher revision client straight off the bat?
EDIT: So I have just been searching the Server Status page and I cannot find a single 317 server that isn't loaded to the bollocks with higher revision content that looks stupid and doesn't fit in. What happened to the good ole days of Project Czar? Someone please host a full time Project Czar. I will marry you and play it every day.

The cache I’m currently developing my server for is pretty old, before farming was added so 2005ish.

pVonC.png773×531

[/quote]
315 or 289?[/quote]No idea actually.

item.title: 317s with higher revision content
item.dc:creator: @BorigTheDwarf BorigTheDwarf
item.description:
@BorigTheDwarf wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:16, topic:440502”][quote author=Bottled Water link=topic=543184.msg3981589#msg3981589 date=1335327393]
even back then project czar was loading higher revision items…
[/quote]
I remember Me making 3 custom dildos for czar, it had stat requirements
lvl 30, lvl 50, and of course lvl 69[/quote]

Yeah but that was fun, and I guess I should have elaborated a bit more on what I was saying. I mean having all these npcs that don’t have the correct animations added, these graphics which don’t move, these items which don’t work as they would in the higher revisions and most of all the stupid gameframes. The 317 gameframe, in my opinion, was the best looking gameframe ever. Ever.

Read full topic

item.title: 317s with higher revision content
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

BorigTheDwarf:

But it’s so ugly!

That is completely subjective. I personally like how the 317’s are presented.

Read full topic

item.title: 317s with higher revision content
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

BorigTheDwarf:

Despite most of this being true it still doesn’t make me happy. Why isn’t there an option in the Server Status List for Unmodified Cache servers and Modified Cache servers (I.e. ones you can play with a Deltascape/Moparscape Client and ones you can’t) Because the main thing I hate is having to download a stupid client every time I want to switch servers, I mean the clients are all essentially the same anyway.

I’ll agree with the last part, but I don’t mind the newer content in 317 servers. It’s much easier to develop content. The only problem is that no one puts real effort into them, instead they just shit out mass releases for bases in hopes that people will love them.

Read full topic

item.title: 317s with higher revision content
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

BorigTheDwarf:

Despite most of this being true it still doesn’t make me happy. Why isn’t there an option in the Server Status List for Unmodified Cache servers and Modified Cache servers (I.e. ones you can play with a Deltascape/Moparscape Client and ones you can’t) Because the main thing I hate is having to download a stupid client every time I want to switch servers, I mean the clients are all essentially the same anyway.

The biggest part of the rsps playerbase are kids that never played the old servers or old rs. Also they are grown up with graphics and stuff,
In the past it was more about gameplay than content, now it’s opposite.
Since the most people who host an rsps want to have as much players as possible they host those ugly higher revision look-a-likes.
And on that they are also a lot newfags themselves.

Read full topic

item.title: 317s with higher revision content
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Newer servers are harder to develop, older servers have tons of content, more people have written tutorials and are ready to help, people like 317s more, the newer client requires a better computer to run, and so on and so forth. It makes more sense to just make a look-alike and do little work rather than have to redo everything you’ve already done just to get some extra client content.

Read full topic

item.title: 317s with higher revision content
item.dc:creator: @frozon566 frozon566
item.description:
@frozon566 wrote:

Because people don’t want to learn the new protocol even though its in the rswiki.

Read full topic

item.title: 317s with higher revision content
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I actually host a server based off of Allstar (heavily changed for the most part) from time to time. You can message me for details if you wish, but it’s not 24/7. I try and host it as much as I can, and a few IRL friends/old players still get on from time to time. I usually hop on and play if someone else does too. PI is garbage to even look at anymore, I know what you mean.

Read full topic

item.title: 317s with higher revision content
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:5, topic:440502”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=543184.msg3981069#msg3981069 date=1335275349]
I’ve asked myself this for a while now. The only thing I can think of as to why is the fact it doesn’t require nearly as much running java process as the actual higher protocols.

HOWEVER, in this day and age 317’s have horrible networking and such as well so stability is a large concern.
[/quote]
Make detailed tutorials for all 317 bases for better networking,
problem solved.[/quote]networking is fairly advanced even I don’t know everything about it. I have a lot to learn concerning networking.

99% of the server owners are leechers so it doesn’t help the fact. A person like you and I would take the time to learn the fundamentals of networking to see how it’s done. the other 99% though would not.

Read full topic
